citation.article-title: Transfer of Micropolyspora rectivirgula (Krassilnikov and Agre 1964) Lechevalier, Lechevalier and Becker 1966 to Faenia gen. nov.

p.s: Faenia (Faen. i' a. L. n. faenum hay; L. f. pl. Faenia a genus of bacteria associated with hay)
Faenia mycelium consists of branching aerial and substrate hyphae which are gram positive and 0.8 to 1.2 μm in diameter.
Spores are 0.7 to 1.5 μm in diameter and are produced in chains of 2 to 15 on both aerial and substrate hyphae, usually on small sporophores.
Spores grow slowly on most complex media at 35 to 60°C.
The cell walls are type IV and contain meso-diaminopimelic acid, arabinose, and galactose; no nocardomycolic acid has been detected.
The type species is F. rectivirgula (Krassilnikov and Agre) comb. nov.
